results.title: Switch on the night
results.creator_credit: Sarah Royds, Susan Cornish, Alejandra Canales and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A poetic documentary exploring stories of seven refugee children in Australia – their experiences of immigration, their memories, dreams and fears. All of them have experienced life in Australian immigration detention centres in Villawood, Baxter and Port Hedland but a large part of this reality remains unseen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Royds, Susan Cornish, Alejandra Canales and AFTRS

results.title: The Saviour
results.creator_credit: Stuart Parkyn, Peter Templeman and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Malcolm is a gentle, effective door-to-door evangelist who is in love with a married woman. With pressure mounting from his church to convert her, Malcolm decides his bible is the very weapon he needs to destroy the marriage that is keeping him from his true love. Grand Jury Prize for Best Narrative Short, Slamdance Film Festvial, Park City, USA, 2006
Cast includes Thomas Campbell, Susan Prior, David Somerville, Rhys Muldoon, Nicholas Hammond.

results.title: Butterfly man
results.creator_credit: Justin Davies, Samantha Rebillet and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The evolutionary tale of Don Herbison-Evans, a man who studies butterflies then experiences a human metamorphosis on the dance floor. A warm-hearted documentary that beautifully illustrates an aspect of the human experience.
results.description: The evolutionary tale of Don Herbison-Evans, a man who studies butterflies then experiences a human metamorphosis on the dance floor. A warm-hearted documentary that beautifully illustrates an aspect of the human experience.

results.title: AFTRS 1994 graduate showreel. Tapes 1 and 2
results.brief_description: Tape 1: Universal Appliance Co (dir. Andrew Lancaster, 9 min.)—Roses are red (dir. Marcella Hayward, 12 min.)—Pandora’s box (dir. Annie Beauchamp, 6 min.)—A Bit of a tiff with the Lord (dir. Peter Duncan, 24 min.)—Bullet proof and blind (dir. Paul Healy, 8 min.)—Fuckwit (dir. Daniel Krige, 18 min.)—Falung (dir. Nina Veretennikova, 20 min.)—Tran the man (dir. Rowan Woods, 17 min.) Tape 2: Unacceptable behaviour (dir. Susan Wallace, 27 min.)—Concrete flesh (dir. Andrew G. Taylor, 9 min.)—Nightwork (dir. Jane Schneider, 13 min.)—The Rockhopper (dir. Wenona Byrne, 13 min.)—It’s time (dir. Liz Doran, 12 min.)—Run beside me (dir. Peta Allen Shera, 5 min.)—El Angelito (dir. Guillermo Martin Sepulveda, 20 min.)—Simple (dir. Polly Seddon, 14 min.)

results.title: Tread softly
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Di Drew and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Claire (Robyn Nevin) and Angela (Natalie Bate) have only been been living together for a short time but Claire’s constant attention has already become suffocating to Angela. She needs space and time to be alone.
The painful final stages of an affair that is over but not yet finished.

results.title: Kindred
results.brief_description:
A drama about incest based on a number of case studies. Penny tries to make her mother and younger sister face the reality of her situation as a victim of parental incest.
Written by Debra Oswald and starring Alyson Best and Russell Newman.

results.title: The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris
results.creator_credit: Richard Brennan, Richard Wherrett and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Regarded as one of Australia’s acclaimed theatre and artistic directors, Richard Wherrett has transformed his directing skills into film with this adaptation of “The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris. Cast includes Tony Llewellyn-Jones, Judy Morris, Anna Volska and John Clayton. Director of Photography, Geoff Burton.
